sn48.44:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in Sāvatthī at the eastern gate.
sn48.44:4.3: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Sāriputta:
sn48.44:4.5: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless?”
sn48.44:5.1: “Sir, in this case I don’t rely on faith in the Buddha’s claim that
sn48.44:5.2: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.
sn48.44:5.4: There are those who have not known or seen or understood or realized or experienced this with wisdom. They may rely on faith in this matter.
sn48.44:5.7: But there are those who have known, seen, understood, realized, and experienced this with wisdom. They have no doubts or uncertainties in this matter.
sn48.44:5.10: I have known, seen, understood, realized, and experienced this with wisdom.
sn48.44:5.11: I have no doubts or uncertainties that the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”
sn48.44:6.2: There are those who have not known or seen or understood or realized or experienced this with wisdom. They may rely on faith in this matter.

sn48.44:6.6: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, samādhi and wisdom, when developed and cultivated, culminate, finish, and end in the deathless.”
